history.text: Howdy.
Hi there!
The movie we have been assigned is "The Notebook." I love this movie! You should see it! Ryan Gosling is in it!
How old is it? When did it come out?
I don't think I've heard of it. What is it about?
I am not sure when it came out, but I do know that it is based on the Nicholas Sparks novel written in 1996.
It is about a young couple who fall in love in the 40's
Ah, I've heard of Nicholas Sparks. I'm pretty sure my wife likes his stuff.
So, a love story?
And I assume you mean the 1940's. Not in the future.
Oh well, Rachel McAdams, is in it....might be more appealing to you LOL
Ah, yes. I do like Rachel McAdams.
Did you just see it, or was it a while ago when it came out?
Yes, 1940's lol. Yes, a love story with some break ups and make ups
No, its my go to drama/romance movie...

Rachel McAdams has the best smile. But, that's probably not the point of this conversation. So, that's your whole argument for me seeing it? It's a love story? Or, because it has Rachel McAdams in it? Anything surprising in it? A twist?
There are some twists...the parents ban them from seeing each other....she moves away
It is just beautiful, it is narrated by the future man who has loved her all of his life....

Wow...you're a real person. And, I'm guessing, a woman (since I mostly admitted I'm a man).  I think that might be a first for me in this situation on MTurk! Wait...so, the male protagonist throughout the movie isn't the one narrating it?
Meaning the older character played by Ryan, his name is Noah
Hmmm...would you characterize this as a "chic flic"?
(Apologies if that's offensive.)
I am! Every day, after Allie (Rachel) leaves...No not offensive, if you consider American romantic dramas, chick flicks..then yes LOL but my husband loves it LOL don't tell him I said so
Noah writes a letter to her for a year
They are 17 and he knows then how much he loves her. But, her mom keeps the letters from her and she becomes engaged because she doesn't know!!

I like most movies. I lean towards science fiction and fantasy, but I will watch whatever is available. When I'm watching with my wife...she bans any and all of my preferred genres and we watch things like...The Notebook (at least, based on your description, that's the kind of thing we watch). I know she has read a bunch of Nicholas Sparks books. I will MAYBE mention this movie to her to see if she's interested.
Meddling parents. I was just going to comment on how old-fashioned that is, but you said it's from the 40's, so, that answers that.

Of course she'll be interested, actually. There's no debate about that. And being as I will watch anything, there's really no reason for us not to watch it, so I may as well just rent it from Amazon or whoever has it and call it a date.
Does it appeal to all ages (well, all adult ages)? How old are you and your husband (who, apparently, loves it)? How long have you been married?

The story is amazing to watch. I wish I would be able to find out what you think LOL No man walks away without tears in this one. I think it does appeal to all ages. I am 40 and my husband is 31. We have been married for 3 years
NO MAN WALKS AWAY WITHOUT TEARS!?
Pretty strong words.

This May is our 30th anniversary. Now, I have watched "Lost" twice, and both times, during the finale, I did cry. Well, there were tears. No, it was definitely crying. But, that was "Lost".  The best serial drama on TV EVER. So, you're trying to tell me that "The Notebook" is the equivalent of "Lost"?
And since you were forthcoming, my wife and I are 51.
She is 27 days older than me...and won't let me forget it.  "Respect your elders", she says.
How long have you been turking?
I am not sure if we are done with the task or if I will get rejected for going off story, but what evs...I have been turking for about a month.

Seriously, I don't think I've ever been paired with an actual person before. This is kind of cool. Not that it should be; chatting online is nothing new. But the novelty of a survey that's not based on deception and that has a real person on the other end is so rare (for me) that is is, indeed, a novelty.
Very minimally. I have a 18 month old, so I get MAYBE and hour on here.
I don't think we'll get rejected, so long as you don't give me more information than was in whatever you read.
I am surprised that turking is an actual paying thing...I have been looking for work from home work for so long and its all scams! I work, but wanted to make just some extra...
I do not think I did LOL
And the end result was that you will watch it!! So WINNING! LOL

Congratulations on your 18 month old.  All mine (three girls) are grown (though the middle one, 28 years old, still lives with us). I started in September or October of last year, and made about $800. So far this year I've made about $320. 
 Well, I see the Finish Conversation button is available. It was a real pleasure chatting with you.
Yes, I am DEFINITELY going to watch "The Notebook". You're very persuasive.
You as well sir! Good luck in life to you! Thank you for making this fun!
RI out!
Have a good night!  Bye...

uid2response.feedback: The other person was persuasive, and I know that my wife has read books by Nicholas Sparks, so I will rent this for us to watch.  I must say, I am convinced that the other person was a real person, something that I don't think I've ever experienced before on MTurk.  So, that was a fun conversation!
